Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: INTERVAL IDENTIFIER: Code identifying each unique interval.
Column Comment.3: ZONE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the producing zone (formation) of the well.
Column Comment.4: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: BASE MEASURED DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of thezone interval.
Column Comment.7: BASE MEASURED DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.8: BASE TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: True vertical depth measured straight down fromthe surface to the base of the zone interval.
Column Comment.9: BASE TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH OUOM: Base true vertical depth original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: TOP DELTA X: Delta X offset from the surface location to the top of the interval.
Column Comment.15: TOP DELTA X OUOM: Top delta X original unit of measure.
Column Comment.16: TOP DELTA Y: Delta Y offset from the surface location to the top of the interval.
Column Comment.17: TOP DELTA Y OUOM: Top delta Y original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: TOP MEASURED DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the zoneinterval.
Column Comment.19: TOP MEASURED DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: TOP TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: True vertical depth measured straight down from thesurface to the top of the zone interval.
Column Comment.21: TOP TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH OUOM: Top true vertical depth original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
